titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Merrill J. Mattes Papers, 1935-1964

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Ann Mulfort March 2013

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Merrill J. Mattes papers

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

bioghist.head: Biography of Merrill J. Mattes
bioghist.p: Merrill John Mattes (1910- ), a historian, worked for the National Park Service (NPS) for 30 years, beginning as a ranger at Yellowstone National Park in 1935. He was superintendent of Scotts Bluff National Monument from 1935-1946, acting custodian of Fort Laramie National Monument (later Fort Laramie National Historic Site) beginning in 1938, and was acting historian for Fort Laramie from 1939-1946. Mattes was regional historian at the NPS Region 2 office in Omaha, Nebraska from 1946-1966, chief of history and historic architecture in San Francisco, California from 1966-1971, and manager of the historic preservation team at the NPS Denver Service Center from 1971-1975. He became an independent historical consultant in 1976. In 1944, Mattes testified as an expert witness against the state of Wyoming's lawsuit challenging the creation of the Jackson Hole National Monument.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection is chiefly materials on Wyoming including copies of Mattes' National Park Service files of correspondence, memorandums, maps, reports, photographs, negatives, legal documents, and printed materials related to Fort Laramie, Yellowstone National Park, Grand Teton National Park, Jackson Hole National Monument, Fort Phil Kearny, Fort Caspar, Fort Bridger and the Oregon Trail. Collection also includes two boxes of note cards containing bibliographic citations and research notes on the history of Jackson Hole and the fur trade.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Merrill J. Mattes at the date of processing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was received from Merrill J. Mattes in 1949 and 1977.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The finding aid was encoded by Katelyn Wittenborn and D. Claudia Thompson in September 2020.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Item Description, Box Number, Folder Number, Collection Name, Collection Number, American Heritage Center, University of Wyoming.
